DataElement.preferredName: Derived Pack Year 6 digits 2 Decimal Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A calculation of a value to quantify the amount a person has smoked over a long period of time. Derived by multiplying the length a subject has smoked (in years) by the number of packs smoked per day.  [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The amount a person has smoked over the course of their life.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number of individual items packaged as a unit.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: A number of individual items packaged as a unit.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/21/14 unretired DEC as part of Rel CDE w Retired DEC review, associated CDE used by multiple context, added CDE CS/CSIs.  jc 2/9/12 - Retired as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).  5/25/07 - Released per FBPP approval.   5/23/07- Removed 'current' from semantics per FBPP direction to generalize the DEC; still draft new.  5/4/07 Created to support NHLBI FBPP Category 4 data element

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Value expressed as a number with 6 total digits with 2 digits after the decimal. [Manually-curated]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Six Mathematics Digits 2 Decimal Place Number
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:No Value Exists:No Value Exists:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/13/2015 removed upside down question mark from change note. jk  2/10/12 FBPP content retired per Jenny Larkin (NHLBI); VD reused by other context (DCP, CCR) and kept released.  5/4/07 - versioned to use concepts that better represent a 6 digit 2 decimal number; 12/14/06-to support the NHLBI-FBPP

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/10/12 - Retired FBPP as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).  5/25/07 - Released per FBPP approval.   5/23/07-Retired Phased Out for creation of a single derived CDE to handle Current, Prior and Non-Smoker cases in one CDE.  5/9/07 - Definition update for FBPP comments.   5/4/07 - Created to support NHLBI FBPP Category 4 data element
